page.text: Ambitious student with excellent research, analytical and problem solving skills. Dedicated biology major: pro-active,
conscientious and possessing a strong motivation to succeed. Seeking an opportunity to apply my education and
experience to begin my career in healthcare.
. Excellent analytical skills . Results driven
. Collaborative team member . Self Starter
Laboratory Techniques: Aseptic Technique, PCR, Recrystallization, Thin layer chromatography (TLC), Vacuum Filtration
Software: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Windows and Mac operating systems
The Riverhead Foundation for Marine Research and Preservation, Riverhead, NY- Summer 2014
– Responsible for maintaining daily operations of the animal hospital
Conducted lab research on blood samples
taken from live animals and analyzed water quality of the environment for all patients in the hospital. Assisted in
conducting patient physicals which included ultrasounds and lab work. Volunteered to be lead team member for
physicals on distressed animals. Participated in emergency response that included rescuing animals injured or in danger
in the field.
Beacon Hill Civic Association, Boston, MA- Summer 2013
Intern – Assistant to the Executive Director. Duties included obtaining construction permits, organizing and preparing
materials for association events, daily updates for social media accounts for community announcements. Created
database to archive materials from Association events. Informed homeowners of day-to-day construction operations and
any unforeseen issues with potential to interrupt or impact quality of life. Solved computer/technical problems.
Suffolk University, Boston, MA- September 2011 – 2012
Environment Representative – Planned, organized, and staffed on campus events promoting environmental
awareness and sustainable living. Implemented measureable change to achieve these goals.
Ameriprise Financial, Bohemia, NY- Summer 2010
Intern – Selected for a Northport High School Academy of Finance Internship. Transformed thousands of confidential
client files from paper-based to leading edge database technology, in advance of project schedule. Gained firsthand
knowledge of financial planning and its impact on retirement planning.
Suffolk University- Boston, MA

text.b: Inducted to TriBeta Biological Honor Society

page.text: Suffolk University – Franklin Park and Boston Common (Boston Shine) Cleanup Project
Boston Food Bank - Volunteer
Saint Phillips Church – Volunteer for creating Holiday packages and maintaining food pantry
Northport High School – Member of Students for 60,000. Fundraisers and Relay for Life
American Legion - Volunteer for town events
Mr. James Araujo: Professor at Suffolk University, jaraujo@suffolk.edu
Ms. Daniella Ferina: Biologist at The Riverhead Foundation for Marine Research and Preservation,
dferina@riverheadfoundation.org
Ms. MaryLee Halpin: Executive Director of Beacon Hill Civic Association, info@bhcivic.org or (617) 277-1922
